meanings.definition: To surpass in bravery or courage.
meanings.sent1: She outbraved her fear and climbed to the top of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The knight outbraved all his opponents in the jousting tournament.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse outbraved the big cat by standing its ground.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter outbraved the raging flames to save the trapped family.
meanings.sent5: The young hero outbraved all odds to rescue the princess from the dragon.

meanings.definition: To face or resist boldly or defiantly.
meanings.sent1: Despite the danger, she outbraved the storm and continued her journey.
meanings.sent2: The protestors outbraved the authorities and stood their ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel outbraved the gardener by stealing all the nuts.
meanings.sent4: The determined student outbraved the difficult exam with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The brave soldier outbraved the enemy's attacks to protect his comrades.
